page.title: 12HAMSWELL HOUSE, COLD ASHTON.
page.content: {Hamswell House}is a building of special{architectural and historic interest.From the shell porch at the front there are beautiful{views}over the terrace and along the valley to Hamswell hamlet. Originally{owned}by Cold Ashton Priory,over the centuries it has been owned by the Popplewell family (mayors and merchants of Bristol),Dick whittington's family,the Wills family and Lady Dulverton.In the time of the {Civil War}it was owned by a cavalier and the story goes that the body of a cavalier who had apparently been hiding in a secret passage was found in recent years during alterations. Around the house are extensive out buildings, cottages and farm buildings. The{estate}has now been split up and sold separately as seems to be the trend.
